verses.roman:
āmi--ajña, 'hita'-sthāne māni 'apamāne'
indra yena kṛṣṇera nindā karila ajñāne

synonyms: āmi—I; ajña—ignorant fool; hita-sthāne—what is for my benefit; māni—I consider; apamāne—as an insult; indra—King Indra; yena—as; kṛṣṇera—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; nindā—offense; karila—did; ajñāne—out of ignorance.
translation: "I am an ignorant fool, for I interpret as an insult what is meant for my benefit, just like King Indra, who out of ignorance tried to surpass Kṛṣṇa, the Supreme Lord.
